ws.rocket.path.annotation

Annotation Type RootNode


  • @Documented
@Qualifier
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value={PARAMETER,FIELD,METHOD})
public @interface RootNode
    CDI qualifying annotation, which triggers a tree construction where the root node value is with provided name or type. When omitted, the field or parameter name is used for looking up a CDI bean with the same name. This annotation must precede a variable with type of TreeNode.

    Usage: specify either the root node value bean name or type. Do not specify both as only one will be used:

    1. type when type != Object.class;
    2. value when type == Object.class.

    This annotation refers to a value bean of the root node to be created. When the resolved bean is also annotated with TreeNode annotation, it will be used to create subtrees of the root node.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.Class<?> type
      The type of the bean to be used as TreeNode value object.
      java.lang.String value
      The name of the bean to be used as TreeNode value object.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract java.lang.String value
        The name of the bean to be used as TreeNode value object. Defaults to field or parameter name where the annotation is used.

        To be effective, the targeted value bean must be annotated with Named annotation.

        This annotation value is used when the type() attribute value equals to Object.class.

        Returns:
        The name of the value bean according to CDI.
        Default:
        ""

      • type

        public abstract java.lang.Class<?> type
        The type of the bean to be used as TreeNode value object. Defaults to Object.class, which means that this attribute won't be used.

        When using type, the CDI needs to resolve it to exactly one bean or tree construction will fail.

        This annotation value is used when the this attribute value does not equal to Object.class.

        Returns:
        The type of the value bean.
        Default:
        java.lang.Object.class
